{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3076249,"name":"","username":"Ashray.g","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ashray.g/{size}/194161_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-08T23:36:18.953Z","cooked":"

6036 has implemented a new lab sign-in and sign-out system.

We have a fingerprint sensor on which people can put their finger, which will toggle whether they are in or out. This data gets sent to a database hosted by MongoDB.

For security concerns, the fingerprints are not directly stored anywhere except in a hash form with high-level encryption.

We have also created a web dashboard to display who is currently at the lab:

Screen Shot 2022-08-08 at 16.32.511174√ó808 57.2 KB

Come to lab.

Be advised that some states have laws requiring parental consent to collect biometric data of minors. We built a similar system a few years back and a parent kindly informed us of the law in Illinois.

kylelanman:

laws

Right! That‚Äôs why we use a barcode label that‚Äôs stored on a rack next to the scanner. Works fairly well; haven‚Äôt detected abuse; and luckily our mascot is not a zebra.

That makes sense but since we are based out of a garage, not everyone has their student ids and not all from one school

We used to use a clipboard with a list of everyone‚Äôs name, but I have made a new program that may get implemented this year, which will basically involve everyone either scanning a private QR code with a webcam on the attendance computer or entering in their unique code and it logs the time in a file. This should help us to determine who actually shows up and who is there for much less time.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2022-08-09T00:59:40.617Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":64.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":414004,"topic_slug":"lab-sign-in-system","display_username":"Ankur Raghavan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50601,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5‚Åµ-4‚Å¥"},"post_url":"/t/lab-sign-in-system/414004/9","custom_user_title":"5‚Åµ-4‚Å¥","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3076307,"name":"sanddrag","username":"sanddrag","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/c68b51/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-08-09T05:24:19.802Z","cooked":"
Weldingrod1:

Ours uses the baroness that are already on their student IDs‚Ä¶

Back when I was teaching, we only had bar codes on the student IDs. How things have changed.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2022-08-09T05:24:19.802Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":197,"readers_count":196,"score":104.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":414004,"topic_slug":"lab-sign-in-system","display_username":"sanddrag","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1082,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/lab-sign-in-system/414004/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3076323,"name":"Thomas Gormley ","username":"ThomasG","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thomasg/{size}/175045_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-09T12:10:26.298Z","cooked":"

I am not a lawyer this is not legal advice.

Quick google search of ‚Äúlaws restricting the collection of biometric data of minors in California‚Äù yields no results that indicate such restrictions exist within the state.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2022-08-09T12:10:26.298Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":177,"readers_count":176,"score":45.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":414004,"topic_slug":"lab-sign-in-system","display_username":"Thomas Gormley ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53024,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Dean's List Winner 2022 | Field Supervisor"},"post_url":"/t/lab-sign-in-system/414004/11","custom_user_title":"Dean's List Winner 2022 | Field Supervisor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3076325,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-09T12:19:26.501Z","cooked":"

For alternates to fingerprint:

These RFID Readers are what we use for our login system. They integrate well with both arduino and Raspberry Pi. Furthermore, we put stickers like these on the back of the students‚Äô nametags, so they can just use their nametag for sign-in (which they should be wearing their nametag at all times anyway).

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2022-08-09T12:19:26.501Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":173,"readers_count":172,"score":39.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":414004,"topic_slug":"lab-sign-in-system","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/YARONGTECH-50pcs-MIFARE-Classic-adhesive-Sticker/dp/B01LZYOR7P","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Amazon.com","clicks":12},{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/SunFounder-Mifare-Reader-Arduino-Raspberry/dp/B07KGBJ9VG","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":11}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/lab-sign-in-system/414004/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3076329,"name":"Vlad B","username":"vladb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vladb/{size}/199590_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-09T12:48:26.796Z","cooked":"

While no such (explicit) restrictions exist for minors, almost all states have laws requiring informed consent regarding biometric collection and usage. A notable example being The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), which requires:

  • The right to know about the personal information a business collects about them and how it is used and shared;

from California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) | State of California - Department of Justice - Office of the Attorney General.

Which would probably cover biometric information, and as most students are minors, would require parental approval.

Not legal advice - Do your own research

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2022-08-09T12:48:26.796Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":168,"readers_count":167,"score":73.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":414004,"topic_slug":"lab-sign-in-system","display_username":"Vlad B","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.oag.ca.gov/privacy/ccpa","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) | State of California - Department of Justice - Office of the Attorney General","clicks":1},{"url":"https://www.oag.ca.gov/privacy/ccpa#sectionc","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) | State of California - Department of Justice - Office of the Attorney General","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53024,"username":"ThomasG","name":"Thomas Gormley ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thomasg/{size}/175045_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52180,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Systems Engineering | FRC 5113 | Go Lemons üçã"},"post_url":"/t/lab-sign-in-system/414004/13","custom_user_title":"Systems Engineering | FRC 5113 | Go Lemons üçã","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3076331,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-09T12:58:18.371Z","cooked":"

There are more restrictions for under 13. Which is why First does not allow accounts for under 13s.

A lot of these laws apply to businesses. A team is not necessarily a business.

Get parental permission. Don‚Äôt sell the data. Have an alternative login for those how do not want to use the system for whatever reason. You should be good. Don‚Äôt collect DNA samples.

Don‚Äôt use free legal advice from the internet.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2022-08-09T22:24:50.466Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":50.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":414004,"topic_slug":"lab-sign-in-system","display_username":"Dave Ebersol","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":9953,"username":"kylelanman","name":"kylelanman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kylelanman/{size}/3427_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27013,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/lab-sign-in-system/414004/17","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3076494,"name":"","username":"Ashray.g","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ashray.g/{size}/194161_2.png","created_at":"2022-08-10T06:12:51.414Z","cooked":"

Goals

  • Something you can‚Äôt forget/lose
  • Limit people from signing someone else in/out
  • As fast as physically possible so people don‚Äôt forget about it or become too lazy to do it sometimes
  • Digital (so it can we easily viewed with a server and website)

Considered:

  • Type their name in/select it from a list
    ‚ÄìSolves # 1,4,3
    ‚ÄìViolates # 2
  • Texting person‚Äôs phone with confirmation code after they select name from list/type in
    ‚ÄìSolves # 1,2,4
    ‚ÄìViolates # 3
  • Any key, barcode, RFID
    ‚ÄìSolves # 2,3,4
    ‚ÄìViolates # 1
  • Have someone in leadership check people in
    ‚ÄìSolves # 1,2,3
    ‚ÄìEntering data for # 4 violates # 3
    ‚ÄìAlso we can‚Äôt expect people in leadership to always be there or add that additional worry

Solution:

  • Biometrics (fast, easy, digital, just need to keep your fingers attached)
